AI training workshops

Practical AI workshops that rewire workflows.

These are not lecture sessions. We pick real tasks, build reusable prompt systems, and leave your team with a playbook you can keep using.

Schedule a workshop call See AI insights

Format 01

Half-day workshop

Ideal for leadership teams that want a clear AI workflow and fast adoption.

  • + AI workflow map
  • + Prompt starter kit
  • + 30-day follow-up plan

Format 02

Full-day build session

We build real assets together: marketing drafts, SOPs, proposals, and analysis.

  • + Live use cases
  • + Staff enablement
  • + Confidence checks

Format 03

Workshop + rollout

Includes the training plus a short engagement to lock in the new workflow.

  • + Team adoption plan
  • + Prompt library
  • + Leadership reporting

Pricing approach

Value-first pricing, not hourly billing.

We start with a short ROI discovery call to quantify the upside. Pricing is tied to outcomes like time saved, fewer errors, and faster delivery.

ROI discovery

We cover three questions before quoting:

  • 01 Which workflows are most expensive today?
  • 02 What does success look like in 30–90 days?
  • 03 What efficiency or revenue lift is realistic?

Option A

Premium

Full-day workshop + strategy audit + follow-up consulting.

  • + 15–20 hours of follow-up
  • + Custom prompt library
  • + Ongoing Q&A access

Typical investment: $8k–$12k+

Option B

Core

Half-day workshop + consulting support (most popular).

  • + 10 hours of consulting
  • + Workflow templates
  • + 30-day adoption plan

Typical investment: $5k–$8k

Option C

Starter

Shorter training session for a smaller team.

  • + Focused use case
  • + Group training only
  • + Clear next steps

Typical investment: $2.5k–$4k

Outcomes

What your team walks away with.

We focus on speed, consistency, and measurable time savings. Every workshop is tied to business goals, not AI hype.

  • 01 A workflow map for the top 2-3 high value tasks.
  • 02 Prompt templates your team can reuse immediately.
  • 03 A review loop to keep quality and compliance tight.
  • 04 A measurement plan so you can prove ROI.

Objections

Common questions, answered.

Pricing conversations are simpler when we compare cost to outcomes. Here is how I handle the most common objections during workshops.

  • 01 “It’s expensive.” Compared to the cost of slow workflows, most teams see 5–10x returns.
  • 02 “We can do it in-house.” You can, but most teams want an expert to avoid costly missteps.
  • 03 “Can you discount?” We trade scope, timing, or add-ons instead of cutting value.
